channel.title: Comments on: What Does the Desmos for Probability Look Like?
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2017/05/28/what-does-the-desmos-for-probability-look-like/#comment-506">OrangeMath</a>.
Interesting ideas here. I wonder if they would be interested.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to OrangeMath.

Interesting ideas here. I wonder if they would be interested.

item.title: By: OrangeMath
item.dc:creator: OrangeMath
item.description: The engine in CanFigureIt Geometry may have the flexibility to do this. Since CanFigureIt is a small company, funding from a source like the US Census "Statistics in Education" would help.
item.content:encoded: The engine in CanFigureIt Geometry may have the flexibility to do this. Since CanFigureIt is a small company, funding from a source like the US Census “Statistics in Education” would help.

item.title: By: Denis
item.dc:creator: Denis
item.description:
An acquaintance of mine is the founder of https://www.getguesstimate.com/
The goal of the project is not an educational one - rather, it aims to make it easy to do back-of-napkin estimates of various things, but I think it could be interesting for you to check out!
item.content:encoded:
An acquaintance of mine is the founder of https://www.getguesstimate.com/

The goal of the project is not an educational one – rather, it aims to make it easy to do back-of-napkin estimates of various things, but I think it could be interesting for you to check out!
